info.description: This is the public Twilio REST API.
info.title: Twilio - Proxy

get.description: Retrieve a list of all Services for Twilio Proxy. A maximum of 100 records will be returned per page.

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

post.description: Create a new Service for Twilio Proxy

CallbackUrl.description: The URL we should call when the interaction status changes.

ChatInstanceSid.description: The SID of the Chat Service Instance managed by Proxy Service. The Chat Service enables Proxy to forward SMS and channel messages to this chat instance. This is a one-to-one relationship.

DefaultTtl.description: The default `ttl` value to set for Sessions created in the Service. The TTL (time to live) is measured in seconds after the Session's last create or last Interaction. The default value of `0` indicates an unlimited Session length. You can override a Session's default TTL value by setting its `ttl` value.

GeoMatchLevel.description: Where a proxy number must be located relative to the participant identifier. Can be: `country`, `area-code`, or `extended-area-code`. The default value is `country` and more specific areas than `country` are only available in North America.

InterceptCallbackUrl.description: The URL we call on each interaction. If we receive a 403 status, we block the interaction; otherwise the interaction continues.

NumberSelectionBehavior.description: The preference for Proxy Number selection in the Service instance. Can be: `prefer-sticky` or `avoid-sticky` and the default is `prefer-sticky`. `prefer-sticky` means that we will try and select the same Proxy Number for a given participant if they have previous [Sessions](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/session), but we will not fail if that Proxy Number cannot be used.  `avoid-sticky` means that we will try to use different Proxy Numbers as long as that is possible within a given pool rather than try and use a previously assigned number.

OutOfSessionCallbackUrl.description: The URL we should call when an inbound call or SMS action occurs on a closed or non-existent Session. If your server (or a Twilio [function](https://www.twilio.com/functions)) responds with valid [TwiML](https://www.twilio.com/docs/voice/twiml), we will process it. This means it is possible, for example, to play a message for a call, send an automated text message response, or redirect a call to another Phone Number. See [Out-of-Session Callback Response Guide](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/out-session-callback-response-guide) for more information.

UniqueName.description: An application-defined string that uniquely identifies the resource. This value must be 191 characters or fewer in length and be unique. **This value should not have PII.**

get.description: Retrieve a list of all Phone Numbers in the Proxy Number Pool for a Service. A maximum of 100 records will be returned per page.

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) of the PhoneNumber resources to read.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

post.description: Add a Phone Number to a Service's Proxy Number Pool.

parameters.description: The SID parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) resource of the new PhoneNumber resource.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

IsReserved.description: Whether the new phone number should be reserved and not be assigned to a participant using proxy pool logic. See [Reserved Phone Numbers](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/reserved-phone-numbers) for more information.

PhoneNumber.description: The phone number in [E.164](https://www.twilio.com/docs/glossary/what-e164) format.  E.164 phone numbers consist of a + followed by the country code and subscriber number without punctuation characters. For example, +14155551234.

Sid.description: The SID of a Twilio [IncomingPhoneNumber](https://www.twilio.com/docs/phone-numbers/api/incomingphonenumber-resource) resource that represents the Twilio Number you would like to assign to your Proxy Service.

delete.description: Delete a specific Phone Number from a Service.

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) of the PhoneNumber resource to delete.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the PhoneNumber resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) of the PhoneNumber resource to fetch.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the PhoneNumber resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) of the PhoneNumber resource to update.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the PhoneNumber resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

IsReserved.description: Whether the phone number should be reserved and not be assigned to a participant using proxy pool logic. See [Reserved Phone Numbers](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/reserved-phone-numbers) for more information.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all Sessions for the Service. A maximum of 100 records will be returned per page.

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) of the resource to read.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) resource.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

DateExpiry.description: The [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) date when the Session should expire. If this is value is present, it overrides the `ttl` value.

FailOnParticipantConflict.description: [Experimental] For accounts with the ProxyAllowParticipantConflict account flag, setting to true enables per-request opt-in to allowing Proxy to reject a Session create (with Participants) request that could cause the same Identifier/ProxyIdentifier pair to be active in multiple Sessions. Depending on the context, this could be a 409 error (Twilio error code 80623) or a 400 error (Twilio error code 80604). If not provided, requests will be allowed to succeed and a Debugger notification (80802) will be emitted. Having multiple, active Participants with the same Identifier/ProxyIdentifier pair causes calls and messages from affected Participants to be routed incorrectly. Please note, the default behavior for accounts without the ProxyAllowParticipantConflict flag is to reject the request as described.  This will eventually be the default for all accounts.

Mode.description: The Mode of the Session. Can be: `message-only`, `voice-only`, or `voice-and-message` and the default value is `voice-and-message`.

Participants.description: The Participant objects to include in the new session.

Status.description: The initial status of the Session. Can be: `open`, `in-progress`, `closed`, `failed`, or `unknown`. The default is `open` on create.

Ttl.description: The time, in seconds, when the session will expire. The time is measured from the last Session create or the Session's last Interaction.

UniqueName.description: An application-defined string that uniquely identifies the resource. This value must be 191 characters or fewer in length and be unique. **This value should not have PII.**

get.description: Retrieve a list of all Interactions for a Session. A maximum of 100 records will be returned per page.

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) to read the resources from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Session](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/session) to read the resources from.
parameters.name: SessionSid

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) of the resource to delete.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Session](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/session) of the resource to delete.
parameters.name: SessionSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Interaction resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

get.description: Retrieve a list of Interactions for a given [Session](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/session).

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) of the resource to fetch.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Session](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/session) of the resource to fetch.
parameters.name: SessionSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Interaction resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

get.description: Retrieve a list of all Participants in a Session.

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) of the resources to read.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Session](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/session) of the resources to read.
parameters.name: SessionSid

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

post.description: Add a new Participant to the Session

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) resource.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Session](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/session) resource.
parameters.name: SessionSid

FailOnParticipantConflict.description: [Experimental] For accounts with the ProxyAllowParticipantConflict account flag, setting to true enables per-request opt-in to allowing Proxy to reject a Participant create request that could cause the same Identifier/ProxyIdentifier pair to be active in multiple Sessions. Depending on the context, this could be a 409 error (Twilio error code 80623) or a 400 error (Twilio error code 80604). If not provided, requests will be allowed to succeed and a Debugger notification (80802) will be emitted. Having multiple, active Participants with the same Identifier/ProxyIdentifier pair causes calls and messages from affected Participants to be routed incorrectly. Please note, the default behavior for accounts without the ProxyAllowParticipantConflict flag is to reject the request as described.  This will eventually be the default for all accounts.

FriendlyName.description: The string that you assigned to describe the participant. This value must be 255 characters or fewer. **This value should not have PII.**

Identifier.description: The phone number of the Participant.

ProxyIdentifier.description: The proxy phone number to use for the Participant. If not specified, Proxy will select a number from the pool.

ProxyIdentifierSid.description: The SID of the Proxy Identifier to assign to the Participant.

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) to read the resources from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Session](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/session) to read the resources from.
parameters.name: SessionSid

parameters.description: The SID of the [Participant](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/participant) to read the resources from.
parameters.name: ParticipantSid

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

post.description: Create a new message Interaction to send directly from your system to one [Participant](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/participant).  The `inbound` properties for the Interaction will always be empty.

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) resource.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Session](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/session) resource.
parameters.name: SessionSid

parameters.description: The SID of the [Participant](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/participant) resource.
parameters.name: ParticipantSid

Body.description: The message to send to the participant

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) of the resource to fetch.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Session](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/session) of the resource to fetch.
parameters.name: SessionSid

parameters.description: The SID of the [Participant](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/participant) resource.
parameters.name: ParticipantSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the MessageInteraction resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

delete.description: Delete a specific Participant. This is a soft-delete. The participant remains associated with the session and cannot be re-added. Participants are only permanently deleted when the [Session](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/session) is deleted.

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) of the resource to delete.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Session](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/session) of the resource to delete.
parameters.name: SessionSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Participant resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) of the resource to fetch.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Session](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/session) of the resource to fetch.
parameters.name: SessionSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Participant resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) of the resource to delete.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Session resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) of the resource to fetch.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Session resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) of the resource to update.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Session resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

DateExpiry.description: The [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) date when the Session should expire. If this is value is present, it overrides the `ttl` value.

FailOnParticipantConflict.description: [Experimental] For accounts with the ProxyAllowParticipantConflict account flag, setting to true enables per-request opt-in to allowing Proxy to return a 400 error (Twilio error code 80604) when a request to set a Session to in-progress would cause Participants with the same Identifier/ProxyIdentifier pair to be active in multiple Sessions. If not provided, requests will be allowed to succeed, and a Debugger notification (80801) will be emitted. Having multiple, active Participants with the same Identifier/ProxyIdentifier pair causes calls and messages from affected Participants to be routed incorrectly. Please note, the default behavior for accounts without the ProxyAllowParticipantConflict flag is to reject the request as described.  This will eventually be the default for all accounts.

Status.description: The new status of the resource. Can be: `in-progress` to re-open a session or `closed` to close a session.

Ttl.description: The time, in seconds, when the session will expire. The time is measured from the last Session create or the Session's last Interaction.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all Short Codes in the Proxy Number Pool for the Service. A maximum of 100 records will be returned per page.

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) to read the resources from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

post.description: Add a Short Code to the Proxy Number Pool for the Service.

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) resource.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

Sid.description: The SID of a Twilio [ShortCode](https://www.twilio.com/docs/sms/api/short-code) resource that represents the short code you would like to assign to your Proxy Service.

delete.description: Delete a specific Short Code from a Service.

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) resource to delete the ShortCode resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the ShortCode resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) to fetch the resource from.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the ShortCode resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the parent [Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/service) of the resource to update.
parameters.name: ServiceSid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the ShortCode resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

IsReserved.description: Whether the short code should be reserved and not be assigned to a participant using proxy pool logic. See [Reserved Phone Numbers](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/reserved-phone-numbers) for more information.

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Service resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Service resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Service resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

CallbackUrl.description: The URL we should call when the interaction status changes.

ChatInstanceSid.description: The SID of the Chat Service Instance managed by Proxy Service. The Chat Service enables Proxy to forward SMS and channel messages to this chat instance. This is a one-to-one relationship.

DefaultTtl.description: The default `ttl` value to set for Sessions created in the Service. The TTL (time to live) is measured in seconds after the Session's last create or last Interaction. The default value of `0` indicates an unlimited Session length. You can override a Session's default TTL value by setting its `ttl` value.

GeoMatchLevel.description: Where a proxy number must be located relative to the participant identifier. Can be: `country`, `area-code`, or `extended-area-code`. The default value is `country` and more specific areas than `country` are only available in North America.

InterceptCallbackUrl.description: The URL we call on each interaction. If we receive a 403 status, we block the interaction; otherwise the interaction continues.

NumberSelectionBehavior.description: The preference for Proxy Number selection in the Service instance. Can be: `prefer-sticky` or `avoid-sticky` and the default is `prefer-sticky`. `prefer-sticky` means that we will try and select the same Proxy Number for a given participant if they have previous [Sessions](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/api/session), but we will not fail if that Proxy Number cannot be used.  `avoid-sticky` means that we will try to use different Proxy Numbers as long as that is possible within a given pool rather than try and use a previously assigned number.

OutOfSessionCallbackUrl.description: The URL we should call when an inbound call or SMS action occurs on a closed or non-existent Session. If your server (or a Twilio [function](https://www.twilio.com/functions)) responds with valid [TwiML](https://www.twilio.com/docs/voice/twiml), we will process it. This means it is possible, for example, to play a message for a call, send an automated text message response, or redirect a call to another Phone Number. See [Out-of-Session Callback Response Guide](https://www.twilio.com/docs/proxy/out-session-callback-response-guide) for more information.

UniqueName.description: An application-defined string that uniquely identifies the resource. This value must be 191 characters or fewer in length and be unique. **This value should not have PII.**
